workflow.name: Automate ITSM ticket classification and resolution using Gemini, Qdrant and ServiceNow
workflow.description:
## Who‚Äôs it for
This template is ideal for IT support teams, internal helpdesk automation engineers, and developers building intelligent ticketing systems. It helps streamline ITSM workflows by automatically classifying user queries, retrieving relevant knowledge base entries, and triggering incident creation in ServiceNow.

## How it works / What it does
This workflow uses Google Gemini and Qdrant to power an intelligent ITSM assistant. When a user submits a query via chat:

The Text Classifier categorizes the input as an Incident, Request, or Other.
Based on the category:

Incidents are automatically logged in ServiceNow.
Requests trigger an HTTP call (e.g., for provisioning or access).
Other queries are routed to an AI Agent that searches the FAQBase in Qdrant and responds contextually.


The Gemini LLM enriches responses and summaries.
The Qdrant Vector Store retrieves semantically similar answers from a pre-embedded FAQ knowledge base.
The Summarization Chain condenses incident details for better tracking.

Sticky notes are used throughout the workflow to document each node‚Äôs purpose and improve maintainability.

### How to set up

Connect your Google Gemini API, Qdrant, and ServiceNow credentials.
Populate the FAQBase collection in Qdrant with your ITSM knowledge base.
Deploy the webhook to receive chat inputs.
Test the flow using the Manual Trigger node.
Customize the classifier categories and Gemini prompts as needed.


## Requirements

Google Gemini API access
Qdrant vector database with embedded FAQ data
ServiceNow account with API access
n8n instance with LangChain nodes installed


## How to customize the workflow

Modify the Text Classifier categories to suit your organization‚Äôs ticket types.
Add more FAQ entries to Qdrant for broader coverage.
Replace the HTTP Request node with integrations relevant to your ITSM tools.
Adjust the Gemini prompts to reflect your tone and support style.
Extend the workflow with Slack, Teams, or email notifications for ticket updates.

parameters.text: =You are agent search {{ $json.chatInput }} query in the  in the Knowledge base "FAQBase" and give the response from that Qdrant Base  other wise tell no answer found.

options.systemPromptTemplate: Please classify the text provided by the user into one of the following categories: {categories}, and use the provided formatting instructions below. Don't explain, and only output the json.

categories.description: Something is broken or not working (e.g., system down, hardware failure)
Asking for something new installation (e.g., software installation, access request).
Anything that doesn't fit the above (e.g., general queries, spam).

parameters.toolDescription: =Use this tool to get the actual information{{ $json.chatInput }} from the Qdrant  Collection

assignments.name: sample_kb
assignments.value:
Question: How to raise a ticket in an ITSM tool?
Answer: Go to the ITSM portal ‚Üí Click on "Create New Ticket" ‚Üí Fill in the required details (issue type, description, priority) ‚Üí Submit the ticket.

Question: How to check the status of a ticket?
Answer: Log in to the ITSM tool ‚Üí Go to "My Tickets" or "Ticket History" ‚Üí Check the current status (Open, In  Progress, Resolved, Closed).

Question: How to install software using ITSM?
Answer: Raise a "Service Request" ticket ‚Üí Select "Software Installation" ‚Üí Mention the software name and version ‚Üí Submit ‚Üí Wait for approval and installation by IT team.

Question: How to reset your password?
Answer: Go to the ITSM portal ‚Üí Click on "Password Reset" under Service Requests ‚Üí Fill in your user ID ‚Üí Submit ‚Üí Follow the instructions sent via email.

parameters.content:
Node Name: Qdrant Vector Store
Type: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.vectorStoreQdrant
Purpose: Retrieves relevant information from a vector database (Qdrant) based on semantic similarity to the user's input.
Key Parameters:
Mode: retrieve-as-tool
Tool Description:
=Use this tool to get the actual information{{ $json.chatInput }} from the Qdrant Collection
Collection: FAQBase
Credential Used: QdrantApi account

 Use Case:
This node is used to fetch contextually relevant answers from a pre-embedded FAQ knowledge base stored in Qdrant. It enhances the workflow by providing accurate, vector-based retrieval for user queries.

Node Name: Qdrant Vector Store1
Type: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.vectorStoreQdrant
Purpose: Retrieves semantically similar information from the Qdrant vector database using embeddings.
Key Parameters:
Mode: Default (not explicitly set, assumed retrieval)
Collection: Uses the same Qdrant collection as other vector store nodes
Credential Used: QdrantApi account
 Use Case:
Used to fetch relevant knowledge base entries or FAQs based on user input, leveraging vector similarity for intelligent matching.

Node Name: Google Gemini Chat Model2
Type: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatGoogleGemini
Purpose: Generates enriched responses or follow-up actions after classification or retrieval.
 Key Parameters:
Model: Gemini (PaLM)
Credential Used: Google Gemini(PaLM) Api account
Position in Workflow: Typically used after classification or after Qdrant retrieval
 Use Case:
This node helps generate intelligent responses based on the classified input or retrieved FAQ data, enhancing the user experience with contextual replies.

Node Name: Create an incident
Type: n8n-nodes-base.serviceNow
Purpose: Automatically creates a new incident in ServiceNow when the classified category is Incident.
 Key Parameters:
Authentication: Basic Auth
Resource: incident
Operation: create
Short Description: Create Incident based on the input from the user
Use Case:
Triggered when the Text Classifier identifies the input as an Incident, this node logs the issue directly into ServiceNow for ITSM tracking and resolution.

Node Name: Text Classifier
Purpose: Automatically classifies incoming user chat input into one of three predefined categories to route the workflow accordingly.
 Categories Defined:
Incident
Description: Something is broken or not working (e.g., system down, hardware failure)
Request
Description: Asking for something new (e.g., software installation, access request)
Other
Description: Anything that doesn't fit the above (e.g., general queries, spam)

Key Parameters:
Input Text:
 User will ask his query in the input
Output:
Returns a clean JSON object with the classified category, which can be used to trigger conditional logic or route to ServiceNow, Gemini, or Qdrant nodes.

Node Name: AI Agent
Type: @n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.lmChatGoogleGemini
Purpose: Acts as a conversational agent powered by Google Gemini (PaLM), capable of understanding user input, generating intelligent responses, and interacting with other workflow components.
Core Capabilities:
Uses Gemini LLM to interpret natural language queries.
Can respond, route, or trigger actions based on user intent.
Integrates with classification, retrieval (Qdrant), and incident/request handling nodes.
 Key Parameters:
Model: Gemini (PaLM)
Credential Used: Google Gemini(PaLM) Api account
Input: Typically receives chatInput or processed text from classifier or retrieval nodes.
 Use Case:
This node serves as the central intelligence of your workflow, enabling dynamic decision-making and contextual automation. It can:
Answer FAQs using retrieved data
Trigger ServiceNow incidents or requests
Provide enriched responses using LLM capabilities
